name: Consiglio Nazionale degli Ingegneri
goal: The Consiglio Nazionale Ingegneri (CNI - National Council of Engineers) is an association set up by public law for the purpose of overseeing the organisation of the engineering profession at a national level. It operates under the jurisdiction of the Ministry of Justice. Its headquaters are located in Rome. As an institution, the CNI acts as a consultant to both Parliament and the Government on matters concerning the practice of the profession and, in general, problems related to the engineering field. The organisation carries out this duty by drawing up proposals of law or regulations concerning the engineering profession.
interests: Audiovisual and Media, Budget, Climate Action, Communication, Competition, Consumer Affairs, Culture, Customs, Development, Economic and Financial Affairs, Education, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Enlargement, Enterprise, Environment, External Relations, Financial Stability, Financial Services and Capital Markets Union , Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, General and Institutional Affairs, Home Affairs, Humanitarian Aid, Information Society, Internal Market, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Public Health, Regional Policy, Research and Technology, Taxation, Trade, Trans-European Networks, Transport, Youth
euInitiatives:
CNI is deeply involved in projects, study and proposals (both at national and european level) concerning the following main arguments:
- regulation of profession
- mutual recognition of professional qualifications
- public procurement legislation
- common training principles
- professional education and traineeship
- access to and pursuit of the profession
- other matters related to the engineering profession or, in general, to regulated professions
